title: Global youth unemployment rate until 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Youth unemployment rate, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2019 to 2016.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2011.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2011 to 2009.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2014 to 2013.
gold: The statistic shows the global youth unemployment rate from 2009 to 2014 with a forecast up to 2019 . The global youth unemployment rate was at 12.9 percent in 2012 . Youth unemployment Just like the general unemployment rate , youth unemployment is recorded and monitored to gauge the job market situation in a country and worldwide .
